term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - precipitation in sol-gel processing
term.title: precipitation

item.text: Sedimentation of a solid material (a precipitate) from a liquid solution in which the material is present in amounts greater than its solubility in the liquid.

notes.item: When precipitation occurs in sol-gel processing, sol particles have aggregated to a size where gravitational forces cause them to sink or float. Generally, aggregation arises from a change in the sol that reduces the interparticle repulsion.

sources.item: PAC, 2007, 79, 1801. 'Definitions of terms relating to the structure and processing of sols, gels, networks, and inorganic-organic hybrid materials (IUPAC Recommendations 2007)' on page 1824 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac200779101801)
